intro: Melampyrum pratense var. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and woodland edges. Its common name refers to the sticky, glandular hairs on its stems, which can adhere to clothing or skin.
